section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Commercial fish operation" means any activity for which a person is required to possess a tidal fish license under § 4-701 of the Natural Resources Article.
"Commercial fish operation" includes any activity for which a person is required to be licensed as a seafood dealer under § 4-701 of the Natural Resources Article.

"Commercial fishing vessel" means a vessel that is:
owned or leased by a person possessing a tidal fish license under § 4-701 of the Natural Resources Article; and
used in a commercial fish operation.
"Commercial marina" means a marina that leases at least 20% of its slips to commercial fishing vessels.
"Commercial marine repair facility" means a marine repair facility that derives at least 20% of its gross receipts from charges for the repair and maintenance of commercial fishing vessels.
"Commercial waterfront property" means real property that:
"Commercial waterfront property" includes land that is adjacent to or under improvements used primarily for a commercial fish operation or as a commercial marina or commercial marine repair facility.

text.section: The Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or of a municipal corporation may grant, by law, a tax credit against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on commercial waterfront property.
